raw_text:
Pernod takeover talk lifts Domecq
 
 Shares in UK drinks and food firm Allied Domecq have risen on speculation that it could be the target of a takeover by France's Pernod Ricard.
 
 Reports in the Wall Street Journal and the Financial Times suggested that the French spirits firm is considering a bid, but has yet to contact its target. Allied Domecq shares in London rose 4% by 1200 GMT, while Pernod shares in Paris slipped 1.2%. Pernod said it was seeking acquisitions but refused to comment on specifics.
 
 Pernod's last major purchase was a third of US giant Seagram in 2000, the move which propelled it into the global top three of drinks firms. The other two-thirds of Seagram was bought by market leader Diageo. In terms of market value, Pernod - at 7.5bn euros ($9.7bn) - is about 9% smaller than Allied Domecq, which has a capitalisation of £5.7bn ($10.7bn; 8.2bn euros). Last year Pernod tried to buy Glenmorangie, one of Scotland's premier whisky firms, but lost out to luxury goods firm LVMH. Pernod is home to brands including Chivas Regal Scotch whisky, Havana Club rum and Jacob's Creek wine. Allied Domecq's big names include Malibu rum, Courvoisier brandy, Stolichnaya vodka and Ballantine's whisky - as well as snack food chains such as Dunkin' Donuts and Baskin-Robbins ice cream. The WSJ said that the two were ripe for consolidation, having each dealt with problematic parts of their portfolio. Pernod has reduced the debt it took on to fund the Seagram purchase to just 1.8bn euros, while Allied has improved the performance of its fast-food chains.

Shares in both companies have risen as a result.
Pernod has sought acquisitions but refused to comment on specifics.

smollm:1.7b:
The summary is concise and focuses on key points:

1.
The French spirits firm Allied Domecq has raised speculation about a takeover by France's Pernod Ricard.
Reports suggest that the French drinks firm is considering a bid, but has yet to contact its target.
Allied Domecq shares in London rose 4% on 1200 GMT while Pernod shares in Paris slipped 1.2%.
Pernod's last major purchase was a third of US giant Seagram in 2000, the move which propelled it into the global top three of drinks firms.
The other two-thirds of Seagram was bought by market leader Diageo.
In terms of market value, Pernod - at 7.5bn euros ($9.7bn) - is about 9% smaller than Allied Domecq, which has a capitalisation of £0.6bn ($1.2bn; 4.8bn euros).
Last year Pernod tried to buy Glenmorroig, one of Scotland's premier whisky firms, but lost out to luxury goods firm LVMH.
Pernod is home to brands including Chivas Regal Scotch whisky, Havana Club rum and Jacob's Creek wine.
Allied Domecq's big names include Malibu rum, Courvoisier brandy, Stolichnaya vodka and Ballantine's whisky - as well as snack food chains such as Dunkin' Donuts and Baskin-Robbins ice cream.
The WSJ said that the two are ripe for consolidation, having each dealt with problematic parts of their portfolio.
Pernod has reduced its debt to just 1.8bn euros, while Allied has improved its performance by reducing the debt it took on to fund the Seagram purchase.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Pernod Ricard has expressed interest in acquiring Allied Domecq, a UK-based alcohol and snack food firm, according to reports suggesting it could be an acquisition target.
Pernod's shares fell as the company sought acquisitions but hasn't yet contacted its target.
The Wall Street Journal reported a rise in Allied Dome cq shares due to speculation about their potential takeover by Pernod, while Pernod's shares in Paris fell.
Pernod Ricard has recently purchased 25% of Seagram, a US giant, with the move boosting its global ranking.
Pernod has also invested in Diageo for the other two-thirds of Seagram, which was acquired by Diageo as market leader.
The company's share price rose to £5.7bn, while Allied Dome cq had a capitalization of £8.2bn.

Pernod Ricard operates in the alcohol and snack food industry, with segments including whisky brands like Chivas Regal Scotch whisky, rum companies (e.g., Malibu rum), wines (e.g., Stolichnaya vodka), and products for luxury brands.
Allied Dome cq is known for its range of snacks, ice cream, and associated products.
Pernod's recent purchase of Seagram has improved its performance, as the company tried to acquire Glenmorangie but lost out to LVMH.
Pernod Ricard has reduced debt in recent years to fund the Seagram acquisition, while Allied Domecq has seen better performance in its fast-food segment.

PernoD's big names include Malibu rum, Courvoisie rb, Stohlmannnaja & Co ice cream, Dunkin Donuts snack food chain, and Baskin-Robbins yogurt.
Allied Domecq's big brands include Malibu rum, Courvoisie rb, Stohlmannnaja & Co ice cream, Dunkin Donuts, Baslik-Robbins yogurt, and Jacob's Creek wine.
The two firms have each reduced debt to fund their portfolios and are ripe for consolidation.

Pernod shares rose by over 4% in London while its French rival, Seagram, saw its shares decline by almost 1%.
Allied Domecq is a major player in the drinks industry, owning brands such as Malibu rum, Courvoisier brandy, Stolichnaya vodka, and Jacob's Creek wine.
It has also snack food chains like Baskin-Robbins and Dunkin' Donuts.
Pernod Ricard is a global player in the spirits industry with strong presence in several markets, including the US and China.
Due to financial troubles that Allied has experienced over recent years, it may want to sell its stake in Allied Domecq to raise funds for its operations.
This could potentially lead to a takeover of the company by Pernod Ricard, resulting in major changes within the drinks industry.

Both companies have sought acquisitions but haven't contacted each other yet.

Pernod is known for brands such as Chivas Regal Scotch whisky, Havana Club rum, and Jacob's Creek wine, while Allied has holdings like Malibu rum, Courvoisier brandy, Stolichnaya vodka, and Ballantine's whisky - as well as snack food chains Dunkin' Donuts and Baskin-Robbins ice cream.
